snippet: The Pentagon is increasingly relying on private contractors to operate drones for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq....
abstract: United States Air Force confronts shortage of drone pilots by turning to private contractors for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq; use of contractors, who are paid more than service members and prohibited from firing weapons, has controversial history in recent Middle East conflicts.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon is increasingly relying on private contractors to operate drones for reconnaissance missions in Afghanistan and Iraq.

headline.main: Air Force, Running Low on Drone Pilots, Turns to Contractors in Terror Fight
headline.print_headline: Air Force, Short of Drone Pilots, Uses Contractors to Fight Terror
